intro: Dicliptera hazenii, commonly known as the Hawaiian false dandelion, is a perennial herb native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal and lowland areas. Dicliptera hazenii is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems.
